title: 110_hr1837
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. REDEPLOYMENT OF UNITED STATES ARMED FORCES FROM IRAQ." is about the redeployment of US armed forces from Iraq. The President, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the Joint Chiefs of Staff, must submit a plan to Congress within 90 days for the phased redeployment of US Armed Forces from Iraq, including specific dates. Factors to consider include dismantling Iraqi Security Forces. The plan for phased redeployment of US Armed Forces from Iraq includes dismantling all Iraqi Security Forces, with priority given to combat soldiers followed by support personnel. Expedited redeployment may occur if conditions improve faster than expected. The Secretary will start phased redeployment of US Armed Forces from Iraq before specified dates. Congress encourages Iraq to vote on the redeployment plan within 180 days. If not approved by 60% of the Iraqi Council or public, the President should begin redeployment within 60 days. Further deployment will be restricted after phased completion. After phased redeployment of US Armed Forces from Iraq, further deployment will be restricted to protecting US diplomatic facilities and citizens, serving in diplomatic roles, engaging in targeted special actions against terrorist organizations, and training Iraqi Security Forces. The President must make determinations within 90 days of the enactment of this Act. The President must make determinations within 90 days of the enactment of this Act regarding whether the Government of Iraq is effectively combating extremists and ensuring the security of Iraqi Security Forces. Reports detailing the basis for each determination must be transmitted to Congress in classified and unclassified form. The Government of Iraq must show progress in establishing security measures, pursuing reconciliation initiatives, and reducing sectarian violence in Iraq. This includes disarming militias, enacting necessary laws, reforming current processes, amending the constitution, and allocating revenues for reconstruction projects. The President must report to Congress on these efforts within 90 days of this Act's enactment.
